direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with class attributes and modify or check the class list of an element.
Both methods interact with the class attribute but in opposite ways (adding vs. removing).
Both methods manipulate the class attribute, with toggleClass adding or removing based on presence.
classNames() is used internally by hasClass to retrieve the class list for checking.
attr(String, String) is used to retrieve the class attribute value, which is essential for hasClass.
attributes() is used to access the attributes of the element, including the class attribute.
normalize(String) is used to normalize class names, which is similar to the class name handling in hasClass.
